name: HandsOn Triangle
description: A large Triangle-area volunteer opportunity database where you can browse roles by date, interest, organization, and community need.

name: Student Action Board
description: A leadership-focused service program where students identify local needs, plan service projects, and build teamwork and community impact skills.

name: Habitat for Humanity of Durham
description: Volunteer opportunities supporting affordable housing projects in Durham, including build days, site support, and community-based events.

name: Teen Board Sponsored Habitat for Humanity of Durham
description: A teen leadership group (roughly ages 14–18) that supports youth builds, mentoring, advocacy, and community engagement projects.

name: SEEDs Volunteering
description: Volunteer with SEEDs by submitting the volunteer form to help with community garden and environmental projects.

name: Church World Service (CWS) Durham
description: Volunteer with refugee and immigrant support efforts through direct services, advocacy, and community connection programs in Durham.

name: Communities Acting for Refugee Empowerment (CARE)
description: A community support program that pairs refugee individuals and families with local groups that help with education, goals, and long-term stability.

name: Environmental Educations of North Carolina
description: The Environmental Educators of North Carolina (EENC) offers volunteer opportunities through committees, action projects, and special events. Volunteering allows educators to support the statewide community, share their voice, and connect with fellow professionals.

name: Durham Arts Summer Arts Teen Volunteer Program
description: Summer Arts Camps offer rising 10th–12th grade students the chance to volunteer alongside instructors, support staff, and create art with younger campers. The program provides hands-on experience, builds resumes, and can count toward school or organization volunteer requirements.

name: Hub Farm Volunteer Opportunities
description: Hub Farm offers a variety of volunteer opportunities, from working with animals and the land to supporting fundraising efforts. Individuals, families, and groups are welcome to get involved and make a hands-on impact.
